messages: 5970bd1634756232824f68fe3b6bb725 (14:21): now stop leavin irc!
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (14:23): hparker: so stage 1 is like building from a buildtree, stage 2 includes the compiler, and stage 3 includes just about everything?
60ef8eb03f7889973380e99d0248b673 (14:24): Yeah.. but.. Stage3 && emerge -e world after tweaking USE flags ends up with the same thing.. If you want to be anal, emerge -e system && emerge -e world
60ef8eb03f7889973380e99d0248b673 (14:25): the problem with stage1 is that once there's a few updates, it's liable to break in amazing ways
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (14:25): makes sense
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (14:25): mmm, I love my adaptec raid card.
60ef8eb03f7889973380e99d0248b673 (14:26): So, stage3, reboot, edit make.conf, emerge -e system && emerge -e world
60ef8eb03f7889973380e99d0248b673 (14:26): I'm needing a damn u320 and noone is stocking them atm due to adaptec going rohs or whatever
60ef8eb03f7889973380e99d0248b673 (14:27): All I'm finding is some lsi
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (14:27): I have an allergy to SCSI
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (14:27): this is sata
60ef8eb03f7889973380e99d0248b673 (14:27): I need it to work with 2.4 so I don't have to reinstall the system
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (14:27): coprocessed, 64mb cache, etc.
5970bd1634756232824f68fe3b6bb725 (14:27): J4k3: is it battery backed
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (14:28): the machine is on an ups, its got a 7 day battery on it.
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (14:28): on the card itself
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (14:28): yay for safe write caching
60ef8eb03f7889973380e99d0248b673 (14:28): i just set them for write-through and deal with it
60ef8eb03f7889973380e99d0248b673 (14:29): I think over the weekend i'm going to rework my spamtrap... 90 day max listing and i've got over a million damn records :/
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (14:31): I thought you said spermtrap
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (14:31): and I Was about to vomit
a20c00215ff91bf327808fcf6d1b00bc (14:31): cuz I didn't know what a spermtrap was, but that was gonna be pretty damned gross
60ef8eb03f7889973380e99d0248b673 (14:32): It set an all time record a couple of weeks ago... > 30k a day all week with a peak of 37k in a day
60ef8eb03f7889973380e99d0248b673 (14:32): Freakin bind is > 400 meg now...
5970bd1634756232824f68fe3b6bb725 (14:42): hparker: how are you gonna rework it
60ef8eb03f7889973380e99d0248b673 (14:42): gotta remember what needs changed, and then drop the times down
5970bd1634756232824f68fe3b6bb725 (14:43): hparker: the times on what?  just bind?
60ef8eb03f7889973380e99d0248b673 (14:43): i'm running undocumented beta code atm
60ef8eb03f7889973380e99d0248b673 (14:43): Expiring the IPs out of the db
5970bd1634756232824f68fe3b6bb725 (14:43): out of what db?  the smtp pre-connection db?
5970bd1634756232824f68fe3b6bb725 (14:43): or just bind's cache
60ef8eb03f7889973380e99d0248b673 (14:44): It's pumped into pgsql with hourly exports
60ef8eb03f7889973380e99d0248b673 (14:45): that's how I eded upw ith the beta code... Testing the pgsql port
5970bd1634756232824f68fe3b6bb725 (14:57): homie likes him some pgsql
